Package com.cafean.utils

Class LogFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cafean.utils.LogFile
  • public class LogFile
extends java.lang.Object
    LogFile is a class designed to simplify logging and dealing with log files. LogFile can either append to, or roll over logfiles. If rolling, the default number of logfiles is 10. For example: With a baseName of "temp" and a max logs of 10, the first log file would be named "temp.log" and each previous log, from most recent to least, would be named: temp_1.log, temp_2.log, temp_3.log, temp_4.log, temp_5.log, temp_6.log temp_7.log, temp_8.log, temp_9.log

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int LOG_CRIT
      The logging level used to log only critical messages.
      static int LOG_DEBUG
      The logging level used to log debug, warning, info, and critical messages.
      static int LOG_INFO
      The logging level used to log informative, warning and critical messages.
      static int LOG_WARN
      The logging level used to log warning and critical messages.
      static boolean trace
      If true, all logging info goes to System.err

    • Constructor Detail

      • LogFile

        public LogFile​(java.lang.String baseName,
               java.io.File logDirectory,
               boolean rollLogs)
        throws java.io.IOException
        Creates and opens a new LogFile object with the given baseName and logDirectory. sets the logging level to LOG_CRIT; sets the maximum log files to 10;
        Parameters:
        baseName - a String containing the name to base logfile names on;
        logDirectory - the path to the directory used to store log files;
        rollLogs - if true, logs are moved out of the way up to maxLogs; if false, the current log file is appended to.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

        message - a String containing the message to log.
